definition: special/unique/distinguished/especially/unusual/very/abbr. for 特克斯[te4 ke4 si1], tex
to stand/to set up/to establish/to lay down/to draw up/at once/immediately

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

sentences.english: To many Chinese, "Chinas number one sister" is a maverick.
sentences.chinese: 对许多中国人而言，“中国一姐”是一名特立独行者。

sentences.english: To many Chinese, "China's number one sister" is a maverick.
sentences.chinese: 对许多中国人而言，“中国一姐”是一位特立独行者。

sentences.english: But Abaddon was always one apart.
sentences.chinese: 但是亚巴顿总是特立独行。

sentences.english: The Dutch have a tendency to do things differently.
sentences.chinese: 荷兰人有一种做事特立独行的倾向。

sentences.english: I love how... there's so many unique people here.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢这里各种各样特立独行的人们。

sentences.english: The Addu people are fiercely independent and speak differently from people in the capital.
sentences.chinese: 阿杜人极为特立独行，说话都和首都人不同。

sentences.english: Tarter has often been a lone and nontraditional entity in her environment.
sentences.chinese: 在塔特的生长环境中，她一直是特立独行的。

sentences.english: Unlike so many American sweeties, Ellen is absolutely an unordinary actress.
sentences.chinese: 与美国甜心不同，艾伦绝对是特立独行。

definition: to rebel against orthodoxy/to depart from established practices
to make a show of being original or unconventional (idiom)
not following the crowd/to go against the tide
to stand out from the masses (idiom)
standing above the common crowd (idiom); outstanding/excellent and unrivaled
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
